places.addresse: Av. Padre Cacique, 891 - Praia de Belas, Porto Alegre
places.description: Home of Sport Club Internacional, this iconic stadium hosted matches during the 2014 FIFA World Cup and offers guided tours for football fans.
A popular green space in the city, perfect for walks, picnics, and cultural events, with a famous Sunday flea market.

places.addresse: Av. Pres. João Goulart, 551 - Centro Histórico
places.description: An old power plant transformed into a cultural space, offering exhibitions and one of the best sunset views by the Guaíba River.
A vibrant cultural center housed in a historic hotel, featuring art exhibitions, theaters, and tributes to the poet Mário Quintana.
An architectural landmark by Álvaro Siza, this museum showcases the works of Iberê Camargo and contemporary art exhibitions.

places.addresse: R. Comendador Caminha, s/n - Moinhos de Vento
places.description: A charming park in one of Porto Alegre’s most upscale neighborhoods, featuring jogging paths, a pond, and a replica of an Azorean windmill.

places.addresse: Praça Marechal Deodoro, s/n - Centro Histórico
places.description: A beautifully restored 19th-century theater, hosting plays, concerts, and cultural performances in an elegant setting.

places.addresse: R. Dr. Salvador França, 1427 - Jardim Botânico
places.description: One of the most important botanical gardens in Brazil, preserving native plant species and offering a peaceful retreat in the city.
